result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J. Esker

defendant.name: Esker, Brandon J.
defendant.address: 3301 Echo Dells Ave A, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandon J. Esker
Current: 3301 Echo Dells Ave A, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 09-18-2018)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon J. Esker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Brandon J. Esker in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM360, 15CM361, 15CT166, 15CT167
3:09 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Will be arguing sentencing. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 
15CT166 Count 1 (OWI 2nd), 15CT167 Count 1 (OWI 3rd), 15CM360 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
15CT166 BAC .183
15CT167 BAC .146

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty: 15CT166 Count 1 (OWI 2nd), 15CT167 Count 1 (OWI 3rd), 15CM360 Count 1 (Bail Jumping).  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

15CT166 Count 2 is dismissed. 
15CT167 Count 2 is dismissed.
15CM360 Count 2 is dismissed. 
15CM361 dismissed & read-in in its entirety.

Court asks Atty Redfield to make his recommendations for each file. 
Atty Redfield states recommendations to the Court. 

Court notes he is not aware if he can place the defendant in the post-trial supervision program without the DA's consent.  Would need to research that program first.  
Atty Redfield requests an adjournment.  Makes additional statements.  

BY THE COURT:
Court will adjourn.  
Parties are to submit in writing their positions.  
Atty Knaapen asks the Judge to speak with Judge Flugaur or Judge Eagon re: the program.
Comply with all other bonds the defendant has pending.

Defendant Brandon J. Esker in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM360 & 15CM361

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY pleas entered.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond covering both files with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
